availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William D. Ratcliffe (Bracken Co, Ky, tavern keeper & capt 10th Cav USA)

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, tavern keeper and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Julia A. Coons Ratcliffe. Father of Stiles Ratcliffe, Edegle "Edd" Ratcliffe, Kate Ratcliffe, William Ratcliffe, and J. F. Ratcliffe. Tavern keeper in Bracken County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Bracken County in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a captain from September 9, 1862, to September 17, 1863.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Bracken County, May 19, 1879.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 258.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 943.
